author: Cortex XSOAR

automation.description: Pretty print JIRA issue into the incident war room
automation.name: JIRAPrintIssue

automation.description: This script lists all possible transitions for a given Jira issue.
automation.name: script-JiraListTransition

automation.description: This script changes the status field of a Jira incident. It gets the new Jira status of the remote Jira issue and updates the Cortex XSOAR incident status.
automation.name: JiraChangeStatus

automation.description:
This script is used to simplify the process of creating a new Issue in Jira. 
You can specify custom fields using the `customFields` argument.
automation.name: JiraCreateIssue-example

automation.description: This script is used to convert Jira subtasks to a table.
automation.name: JiraV3ConvertSubtasksToTable

automation.description: This script lists all possible statuses for a given Jira issue. Works only for Jira v3.
automation.name: JiraListStatus

automation.description: This script is used to convert Jira comments to a table.
automation.name: JiraV3ConvertCommentsToTable

automation.description: This script applies the transition supplied by the user from the Jira Transitions incident field. It gets the new Jira status after applying the transition and updates the Cortex XSOAR incident status.
automation.name: script-JiraChangeTransition

automation.description: Use this script to add a comment with a tag (the "Comment tag to Jira" defined in the instance configuration) as an entry in XSOAR, which will then be mirrored as a comment to a Jira issue. This script should be run within an incident.
automation.name: JiraAddComment

automation.description: This script is used to convert Jira attachments to a table.
automation.name: JiraV3ConvertAttachmentsToTable

incidentfield.description: The comments returned from a Jira issue.
incidentfield.name: Jira Comment

incidentfield.description: The estimated timeline of a Jira issue in seconds. Please take a look at your `Time tracking settings` in Jira to identify what is considered an hour and a week.
incidentfield.name: Jira Estimate

incidentfield.description: The components of a Jira issue.
incidentfield.name: Jira Component

incidentfield.description: The Jira project where the issue resides in.
incidentfield.name: Jira Project

incidentfield.description: The subtasks of a Jira issue.
incidentfield.name: Jira Subtask

incidentfield.description: The issue type of the Jira issue.
incidentfield.name: Jira Issue Type

incidentfield.description: This will show the current status of the Jira issue, and when pressed, a list of possible statuses will be shown.
incidentfield.name: JiraV3 Status

incidentfield.description: The due date for the issue (in the format 2018-03-11)
incidentfield.name: Jira Due Date

Field must be either of type string (appending by using ',') or array.

commands.description: Get issues from the backlog of a specific board. For Jira OnPrem, the board must be of type scrum.
commands.name: jira-board-backlog-list

commands.description: Returns the ID offset, which is the ID of the first issue that was created in the current Jira instance, or the ID of the first issue with respect to the given query argument if given. You can use its result as the initial ID when fetching incidents by the issue id field.
commands.name: jira-get-id-offset

commands.description: Get the list of incidents that were modified since the last update time. This method is used for debugging purposes. The get-modified-remote-data command is used as part of the Mirroring feature that was introduced in Cortex XSOAR version 6.1.
commands.name: get-modified-remote-data

commands.description: Moves issues to a sprint, for a given sprint ID. Issues can only be moved to open or active sprints. At most 50 issues may be moved at once.
commands.name: jira-sprint-issue-move

commands.description: Use this command to test the connectivity of the Jira instance.
commands.name: jira-oauth-test

commands.description: Get remote data from a remote incident. This method does not update the current incident, and should be used for debugging purposes only.
commands.name: get-remote-data

commands.description: Updates the remote incident with local incident changes. This method is only used for debugging purposes and will not update the current incident.
commands.name: update-remote-system

commands.name: jira-issue-query

commands.description: Returns the comments added to a ticket.
commands.name: jira-get-comments

commands.description: Fetches an issue from Jira.
commands.name: jira-get-issue

commands.description: Moves issues to backlog. If the issues supplied are NOT part of a board that supports sprints, then the board_id argument is required. At most 50 issues may be moved at once.
commands.name: jira-issue-to-backlog

commands.description: Creates a new issue in Jira.
commands.name: jira-create-issue

commands.description: Delete an attachment from an issue.
commands.name: jira-issue-delete-file

commands.description: Use this command to create a link between two issues.
commands.name: jira-issue-to-issue-link

commands.description: Edit a comment that is part of an issue.
commands.name: jira-issue-edit-comment

commands.description: Returns a list of all issue link types.
commands.name: jira-issue-link-type-get

commands.description: Returns the list of fields to map in outgoing mirroring. This command is only used for debugging purposes.
commands.name: get-mapping-fields

commands.description: Use this command to start the authorization process. In order to authorize the instance, first run the command, and complete the process in the URL that is returned. You will then be redirected to the callback URL where you will copy the authorization code found in the query parameter `code`, and paste that value in the command `!jira-ouath-complete` as an argument to finish the process.
commands.name: jira-oauth-start

commands.description: Assigns an assignee to an existing issue.
commands.name: jira-issue-assign

commands.description: Gets specific fields from a Jira issue and adds it to context dynamically.
commands.name: jira-get-specific-field

commands.description: Adds a new comment to an existing Jira issue.
commands.name: jira-issue-add-comment

commands.description: Creates (or updates) an issue link.
commands.name: jira-issue-add-link

commands.description: Delete a comment from an issue.
commands.name: jira-issue-delete-comment

commands.description: Get all epics from a specific board.
commands.name: jira-board-epic-list

commands.description: Deletes an issue in Jira. Issue's sub-tasks will also be deleted if there are any.
commands.name: jira-delete-issue

commands.description: Get all issues that belong to an epic (Child Issues).
commands.name: jira-epic-issue-list

commands.description: Moves issues from backlog to board, the command does not work with boards with sprints. At most 50 issues may be moved at once. This command is only supported for Jira Cloud instances.
commands.name: jira-issue-to-board

commands.description: Uploads a file attachment to an issue.
commands.name: jira-issue-upload-file

commands.description: Get board data. If board_id is given, then only the board that corresponds to the board_id is returned, otherwise, the the command will return boards that match the project_key_id, type, or board_name arguments.
commands.name: jira-board-list

commands.description: This command returns the issue fields, both system and custom fields.
commands.name: jira-issue-list-fields

commands.description: Gets the account ID for a given user attribute.
commands.name: jira-get-id-by-attribute

commands.description: Get all issues in a sprint.
commands.name: jira-sprint-issue-list

commands.description: Download attachments for a specific issue (Will download a file to War Room).
commands.name: jira-issue-get-attachment

commands.description: Get all issues from a specific board.
commands.name: jira-board-issue-list

integration.description: Use the Jira integration to manage issues, create Cortex XSOAR incidents from Jira projects, and mirror issues to existing issue incidents in Cortex XSOAR. The integration now supports both OnPrem, and Cloud instances.
integration.name: Atlassian Jira v3

playbook.description:
Create Jira issue allows you to open new issues.
When creating the issue, you can decide to update based on on the issue's state, which will wait for the issue to resolve or close with StatePolling.
Alternatively, you can select to mirror the Jira issue and incident fields.  To apply either of these options, set the SyncTicket value in the playbook inputs to one of the following options: 
1. StatePolling
2. Mirror
3. Leave Blank to use none

When creating Jira issues through XSOAR, using the mirroring function, make sure that you exclude those issues when fetching incidents. To exclude these issues, tag the relevant issues with a dedicated label and exclude that label from the JQL query (Labels!=).
playbook.name: Create Jira Issue

playbook.description:
Use Jira Incident State Polling as a sub-playbook when required to pause the execution of a master playbook until the Jira ticket state is either resolved or closed.
This playbook implements polling by continuously running the jira-get-issue command until the state is either resolved or closed.
playbook.name: Jira Ticket State Polling

playbook.description: Mirror Jira Ticket is designed to serve as a sub-playbook, which enables ticket mirroring with Jira.
playbook.name: Mirror Jira Ticket

description: Use the Jira integration to manage issues and create Cortex XSOAR incidents from Jira projects.
name: Atlassian Jira
readme:
This pack enables you to manage issues in Jira and exchange information between Jira and Cortex XSOAR.

## What does this pack do?

This pack enables you to

- Create, edit, delete, and query Jira issues.
- Add information to Jira issues in the form of links, comments, and attachments.
- Get information concerning boards, and sprints.
- Create Cortex XSOAR incidents from Jira issues.
- Mirror information from Jira to Cortex XSOAR and vice versa.

The pack includes the **Atlassian Jira v2**, and **Atlassian Jira v3** integration, the **Jira Incident**, and **JiraV3 Incident** incident type, incident fields, incident layouts to display all of the Jira information, and 6 scripts:

- **JiraCreateIssue-example**: Simplifies the process of creating a new issue in Jira.
- **JIRAPrintIssue**: Prints a Jira issue in the War Room.
- **script-JiraChangeTransition**: Gets the new Jira status and updates the Cortex XSOAR incident status by applying a transition.
- **script-JiraListTransition**: Lists all possible transitions for a given issue.
- **script-JiraChangeStatus**: Gets the new Jira status and updates the Cortex XSOAR incident status by choosing a specific status.
- **script-JiraListStatus**: Lists all possible statuses for a given issue.

## How does this pack work?

Create an instance of the **Atlassian Jira v2**, or **Atlassian Jira v3** integration and start fetching and ingesting incidents.
